Authors: Noer H.M., Putra M.A.P., Kusdian D., Sfenrianto
Title: Analysis of the use of land value zone applications (ZNT) for mobile-based data collection, web-based calculation and reporting on improving the performance of regional income staff
Source title: International Journal of Civil Engineering and Technology
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Noer, H.M., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Putra, M.A.P., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Kusdian, D., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sfenrianto, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: For this new method based on Information Technology (IT) is needed in data collection, calculation, and standard reporting as a way to obtain market data, one of which is the Application of Land Value Zones. The purpose of this case study is to find out whether the application will improve the performance of regional income staff. It is hoped that the application will be able to assist in terms of better performance of the results and potential taxes obtained by overcoming the problem. The implementation was carried out directly in Jembrana District of Bali in 2017. This process was carried out with 84 respondents and the results were positive but not significant due to various factors, with results using more than 60% performance improvements. Then it’s clear that there is an increase in performance using the Application and for that information system about taxes can be applied to improve employee performance. © IAEME Publication.
Author Keywords: Application of Land Value Zone (ZNT); Employee Performance; Jembrana Regency; Land Building Tax (PBB-P2); Tax Potential
